I see, but ssh and vnc are different options to do so
if you don't have the need to use graphical environment, just use ssh. That will 'breng' you to the other machine on commandline
if you do want to connect graphically, you'll have to setup vnc and/or xdmcp
vnc requires a vnc server (not a client, which vinagre is)
download/install vnc4server on the machine you want to connect to
on *that* machine start the vncserver on a display of your choice (not 0) like "vnc4server :1", it'll ask you to enter/create a password
the vnc4client
however default in applications > internet is option "remote desktop viewer" which also will do
